resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
lquerel opened a new pull request, #14639:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14639

   [WIP]
   
   Test not working because of a potential issue in dictionary management.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14639#issuecomment-1314555294

     specific language governing permissions and limitations
     under the License.
   -->
   
   Thanks for opening a pull request!
   
   If this is not a [minor PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#Minor-Fixes). Could you open an issue for this pull request on JIRA? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW
   
   Opening JIRAs ahead of time contributes to the [Openness](http://theapacheway.com/open/#:~:text=Openness%20allows%20new%20users%20the,must%20happen%20in%20the%20open.) of the Apache Arrow project.
   
   Then could you also rename pull request title in the following format?
   
       ARROW-${JIRA_ID}: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   or
   
       MINOR: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   See also:
   
     * [Other pull requests](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pulls/)
     * [Contribution Guidelines - How to contribute patches](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/contributing.html#how-to-contribute-patches)

zeroshade commented on PR #14639:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14639#issuecomment-1315588703

   As mentioned on the corresponding JIRA card, if you can give me permission to push to your fork @lquerel then I can push an update which will fix your failures (and rebase against master to fix conflicts)

zeroshade commented on PR #14639:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14639#issuecomment-1315690959

   In order to facilitate this to be able to be cherry-picked into v10.0.1 I'm going to shift the added unit test for the dictionary delta messages to a separate PR. @lquerel Is there anything else you need or is this ready for review? We're going to start putting together changes for the v10.0.1 patch release later this evening, so this can still make it into that patch release if we merge it today.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Currently, the {{emitDictDeltas}} member of the {{ipc.Writer}} type is not exposed. This PR will add a new {{ipc.Option}} that sets it to true.
fields.summary: [Go] Add option to support dictionary deltas with IPC

comments.body: [~zeroshade] see the draft PR. It's still a WIP as my test is still failing. I'm still not sure why.

The issue was with your test. For dictionary deltas to be emitted, the dictionary in the subsequent records you write *must* be an extension of the previous dictionary that was written. The way you were creating the records you were creating them with two *entirely different* dictionaries. This can't work with deltas because the indices would be incorrect and can only work by doing dictionary replacement. 

I merged my previous change in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-18317 and rebased, then updated your test. If you could give me permissions to write to your fork, i'll push the branch. (You probably should have made a new branch to merge for the PR rather than using master on your fork :) )

[~zeroshade]  Thank you. 

You should now have access to my fork.
Thanks [~lquerel] . I've updated your PR (rebased and fixed the tests). I also added a new test in {{message_test.go}} which confirms that it's sending a dictionary delta message properly.
If you're happy with the new version, feel free to mark it "ready to review" instead of a draft. Let me know when you do so or if you have more questions.
